#_A Taste of Sri Lanka ~ 2015_

**Thursday, April 30 -- 6:00 pm - 8:30 pm**  
**The Key Room, 1385 N. Hamilton Parkway, Novato, CA 94949**

Enjoy the redolent spices of Sri Lankan cuisine and learn about three projects offering hope to families.

##_Buffet Dinner Menu_

>**Kaha Bath** - Lightly spiced aromatic long-grained Basmati rice

>**Kukul Mas Curry** - Chicken cooked with spices, Sri Lankan herbs and coconut milk

>**Parippu Hodi** – Mild red lentil curry tempered with shallots, garlic and mustard seeds

>**Curd Sambol** - Thinly sliced cucumber with refreshing yogurt

>**Salad** - Lettuce, tomatoes, beets, cucumber and red onions

>**Desserts** - Watalappam (coconut custard pudding) / Vanilla ice cream topped with roasted cashews and palm treacle

>Complimentary tea, coffee, water and lemonade. Wine will be available for purchase.

All proceeds benefit Water for People; Oma Village, a project of Homeward Bound of Marin; and Sahanasevana, a Sri Lankan charity.

Tickets cost $50 per person. For ticket purchase, e-mail Carmela Chandrasekera at carmelan@comcast.net or call 415-382-6687.


**Water for People** – Since 1991, Water for People has supported development of sustainable healthy water supplies 
in developing countries. Now working in 9 countries, Water for People believes access to safe drinking water and 
effective sanitation are basic human rights accorded by the dignity of all people. www.waterforpeople.org

**Oma Village** – A new supportive housing program of Homeward Bound of Marin, Oma Village in Novato will 
offer 14 small rental homes for families exiting homelessness. Homeward Bound is the county’s largest provider 
of shelter and services, working toward the goal of “ending homelessness with training, housing and hope.” www.hbofm.org

**Sahanasevana** – Sahanasevana, which means “Shelter,” operates in Avissawella, Sri Lanka and is focused on lifting families out of poverty, particularly through education. Scholarships are provided to underprivileged students whose needs range from basic food to schoolbooks.
